Articles.Content:
So I've decided to add a few extra mods to my installation, and because of the requirements of a custom tech tree I need to install quite a few packs.

Is there a way to remove individual parts from a pack? For instance in Nova Punch I'd only want the 2.5 and 3.75m engines, and none of the tanks or other parts
Just delete the parts you don't want in your game data folder. Easy mode.

KSP Mod Admin by MacTee makes trimming parts packs easier: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/26031-Win-KSP-Mod-Admin-v1-3-10-Mod-install-with-a-few-clicks

Using the Parts tab, you can quickly select as many parts as you want to delete, with one click of a button. You can also re-install them just as easily. There are several options for sorting Parts, which helps too...

If you .ZIP or .RAR your Squad folder, then use KSPMA to install it like any other mod, then you can also easily delete/re-install stock parts as well...
